Fields.DialogueText: Ho! Ho! Ho!
... I'm sorry. Is this a Christmas thing, or...?
I'm of the opinion that everyone should always be in the Christmas spirit, no matter the time of year. Here you go!
A red wool hat. And matching mittens?
Put them on! You're going to need them, if the rumors are true.
Rumors? Spill it.
Well... I hope you're not upset, but I may have overheard a little something while I was skating by the radio room.

Fields.MenuText: What did you hear?
Rumours aren't the way we do things on a warship.
You skated by the radio room without crashing? Color me impressed.

Fields.DialogueText: I heard something about our next mission.
I couldn't help it! It's not my fault that they left the door open!
Ha! Getting better every day! That's why I practice on my skates so much.
So is it true? That we're leading a convoy to the Arctic?
I was about to confirm Command's orders, but yes. We have to escort some merchant ships to make sure supplies arrive safely to Arkhangelsk.
Arkhangelsk? In the Soviet Union? Brrr! That's way up north. We'll be covered in ice, Captain!
It's a good thing I have this wool hat.
And mittens. Don't forget about the mittens.
I would never forget about the mittens.
Try on the hat! I know you'll look super cute!
*ALARM*
The fashion show can wait, Sheffield. We've got work to do.
Nonsense! You can wear it during the battle. It'll be your new war hat!
@BATTLE
You wanted to see me, Captain?
Take a good look out there.
Looks like a bunch of old barges and rusty tubs to me.
I suppose that's a fair assessment.
No need to fret, Cap. I can zip around 'em, quick as a wink.
You've got the wrong idea, Sheffield. I don't want you to zip around them.
But I can, easily! You're talking to the Belle of a speedy warship.
A speedy warship in charge of protecting a convoy. We're going to make sure every ship makes it to the Soviet Union.
Oh... but they're so slow. How will they possibly keep up with me?

Fields.MenuText: We only go as fast as the slowest one.
They'll keep up.
We'll do our best to protect them.

Fields.DialogueText: Groan!
Or they'll be gobbled up... by Morganas and Krauts.
I know it, Cap.
I want to do my best... and I will! I'll do my best to get them safely to the Soviet Union, as long as they do their best, too.
We'll make sure they hustle. Slow ships are easy targets.
Don't worry. I won't leave anybody behind.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Hard cheese, Cap.
What are you talking about? We just loaded fresh rations.
It's just a figure of speech. The more I try to stay motivated to escort this convoy of slugs up to Arkhangelsk, the more I think about what a drag they'll be.
Is this really bothering you?
I'm not sure why you're asking me that.

Fields.MenuText: Usually you're eager and cheerful. I don't see this side of you much.
A good captain cares about everybody on board.
I have to know for sure that you're going to do your best.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't have to worry about me. I'm right as rain.
No cause for concern on my account.
No need for doubt, Captain! My heart's in it.
I just like to go fast. I'm a cruiser, after all.
But I promise you, the only time you'll see me cross is if anybody tries to bother our convoy. I'll go from happy to scrappy quick as a wink!
I know it. In fact, I'm counting on it, Sheffield.
If you don't mind, I'm about to zip around in my skates a bit. Just a few laps around the ship.
Be my guest.
Thanks! I'll-
*ALARM*
Hmph! Morgs ought to know not to interrupt my skating time!
Let's show them what they get for being rude...
@BATTLE
Top of the day to you, Skipper. Brought you some tea.
That's thoughtful of you, Sheffield. Thanks.
I know that I'm the ship's Belle, and I'm not trying to make the stewards look bad, but I figured you might enjoy a proper drink.
Heh, I appreciate your concern.
Go ahead, take a sip.

Fields.MenuText: Mmm. Delicious. It's just the way I like it.
I usually have coffee, but it's good.
Why is this making me... a little bit suspicious?

Fields.DialogueText: I've been paying attention!
That's the spirit!
Well...
I was... wondering something.  Mind if I use the radio to address our convoy, Cap?
I should have expected this.
It's just a teensy favor. Can you indulge me this one time?
Fair enough. Please don't make me regret this.
Thank you!
Ahem...
*STATIC*
Attention all ships in our convoy! Attention!
Our mission to bring food and supplies to the Soviet Union is critically important!
It will be cold. It may be dangerous. But I want you to know that I will do my best to get us to Arkhangelsk quickly and safely!
We can do it! That is all. Sheffield out!
Well said, Sheffield.
I just wanted to motivate them to do their best. I'm going to do mine.
I'm sure they appreciate your spirit.
*WHOOOONK*
Did you hear that? The ships are using their whistles to express their enthusiasm.
Either that, or they're trying to warn us about something...
My radar is picking up something on the horizon. Crumbs!
@BATTLE
Hey! Captain! Wait for me! I want to talk to you about--
Watch out!
*THUD*
Whoops!
Are you all right?
Oh, I'm fine. One of these days I'll make it all the way down the steps without crashing!
Taking your skates off might help.
I don't understand. How would that help?
Taking off your roller skates. It would make it easier to get down the steps.
Call me thick in the skull, but I really don't follow you, Captain.
No skates, no crashes.
Right, but... if I took off my skates, how would it still be fun to race down the steps?

Fields.MenuText: Just don't hurt yourself.
Um... I suppose it wouldn't be fun.
All of this crashing must be damaging your brain.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm a Belle! And a tough one, too. It would take a lot more than falling down to hurt me.
Ha! Exactly! Don't feel silly, Captain. I had to think about it, too.
What?
I would appreciate it if you would not try to race down steps on your roller skates.
If you lost control and crashed into somebody else...
I understand. You don't want anybody else to get hurt. I'll be mindful of that, Captain.
Anyone except Morganas.
@BATTLE
I think you're missing the point.
Never mind.
Now that I can promise!
*ALARM*
Damn. The further we go north, the more this wind cuts us to the bone.
Ahoy, Cap!
Cheerful as ever, I see. Give me a status report of the convoy, Sheffield.
All are accounted for. Every single rusty barge and tub, full of supplies for Arkhangelsk, is keeping up.
*FIERCE GUST OF WIND*
Good w-w-w-work.
What was that?
I said "Good work."
It sure is getting nippy, isn't it?

Fields.MenuText: I can handle it.
It is. I'm concerned about the crew.
Aren't you freezing in that outfit?

Fields.DialogueText: A stiff upper lip. How British of you, Cap!
Me, too. Whenever I have spare time, I've been knitting scarves and hats to inspire them.
Nope!
How are you dealing with it, Sheffield?
I can feel the cold, especially the cold water on my hull, but it doesn't affect me the same way it seems to affect everybody else.
Let's make sure the other ships in our convoy are able to handle the weather, too. I don't want them to run into trouble.
Or chunks of ice.
Speaking of which, it looks like you've got some contacts on your Type 79Y. Are those chunks of ice?
Maybe, if ice could drive straight for us at twenty-five knots.
Incoming Morganas! Get us to battle stations, Sheffield.
@BATTLE
Ouch! Captain, I... Ouch!
What's wrong, Sheffield? Are you taking damage? Is it something in the engine room?
No... That's not it. OUCH! What the heck is that? Something's poking me over and over.
I couldn't say. Nothing caught my attention when I walked the weatherdecks, except for the teams breaking up all of the ice.
Breaking up the ice...
That's right. Up here in the Norwegian Sea, we're getting covered in it. Things are frosty topside, but I have teams clearing it away.
That must be it! I think I'm feeling whenever somebody gets in a good shot with an axe and it clangs on the... OUCH!
On the deck.

Fields.MenuText: Sorry it's uncomfortable, Sheffield.
We have to clear the ice so that we don't sink.
Is there another way?

Fields.DialogueText: It's all right, Cap. I can... Ouch! I can handle it.
I understand. Ouch! That ice adds weight that could make us capsize or founder.
I don't think so. Let's just... Ouch! Get it over with.
I'll slow down a touch, to steady us while the crews are working. We can't have anyone slip or... Ow! Or fall overboard. They'd become a popsicle.
Good thinking, Sheffield.
I'm sorry it's uncomfortable for you.
Don't waste another minute worrying about it, Cap. I'm a Belle who can handle herself.
@BATTLE
Speaking of which - ouch! - my radar's picking up something... looks like Morgs, Captain.
At least they'll help break the ice.
Oi, there! Get back in line!
There you are, Sheffield. How's the convoy doing?
Glad to report that we've got things under control. Oh, pardon me for just a moment.
Gairsoppa and Black Osprey, adjust your speed by two knots. Keep up with the group!
You've really taken ownership. Great work keeping our charges organized, Sheffield.
Thanks, Skipper! It's quite a bit of fun, actually.
Nerissa! Correct your course to zero-two-seven.
That's better. Thank you, Nerissa.

Fields.MenuText: Keep pushing those convoy ships hard.
Some of those ships are old. Don't push them too hard.
You're like a proud mama duck with her ducklings.

Fields.DialogueText: That's how they'll stay inspired to keep up, Skipper. I know what I'm doing.
They all had enough heart to volunteer for the mission. Deep down, I know they can make it.
All in a tidy row. Quack quack!
Ugh!
What is it? Is your radar tingling?
You're spot on, Cap. My Type 79Y has detected incoming contacts from the east, possibly Morganas.
Let's keep them away from our ducklings.
@BATTLE
The ice is really starting to get heavy up here, isn't it?
Dodging all of these frozen chunks makes me feel like I'm sailing in a huge bowl of ice water.
We're all freezing our tails off, but I guess that means we're going the right direction.
That's the right attitude, Cap. We're moving into the Barents Sea and making good time to the Soviet Union.
It's definitely getting worse as we go north, but we've been making good time.
I'm looking forward to seeing more ice, too.

Fields.MenuText: You've got to be kidding. Why would you want to see more ice?
I'll be glad to get home. England's a tropical paradise by comparison.
If you're a masochist, sure.

Fields.DialogueText: That should be obvious, silly.
There's one thing you can't do in a tropical paradise, though.
No, really! You know why?
Ice skating!
I should have guessed...
Hah! You always have to figure out something to look forward to, right?
I look forward to bringing my crew and ship safely home.
And I'll do my best to make that happen, Captain.
@BATTLE
My radar's picking up some Morgs... The ice skating will have to wait.
Take that!
*RUMBLE*
Ooof! And take... THAT!
*RUMBLE*
Should I be worried?
Hi there, Cap! No reason to fear. I'm just negotiating a path for us through these big chunks of ice.
Negotiating? That's a funny word for it. It sounds more like you're using the hull as a battering ram.
Our convoy has to get through somehow.

Fields.MenuText: Impressive technique! No matter what they say about you, they can't say you aren't tough.
Don't be reckless. Icebergs sink ships, you know.
What is it with you and crashing into things all the time?

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Cap! Um, hold on a moment... what do they say about me?
I know my limits, thank you very much.
Honestly, I don't mind it all that much.
A few lumps and scratches don't scare this Belle, Cap. We can't let things like that stop us from being the best!
*BOOM*
Ooof!
That wasn't ice!
Agreed. That's Morgana gunfire, Cap!
@BATTLE
Battle stations!
Ungh!
Keep pushing, Sheff!
Trying, Cap! This chunk of ice is quite the monster.
Getting through this northern ice is getting more and more difficult, but we have to keep pushing through.
Engines are at full steam. This frozen bastard will be out of our way in... oomph! In a jiffy.
The sooner the better. Our convoy needs to keep moving if we're going to get to Arkhangelsk on time.

Fields.MenuText: I wonder how much worse the ice will get?
I know we're going to make it through.
I believe in you, Sheffield!

Fields.DialogueText: I can't worry about that now. One iceberg at a time!
That's the spirit, Cap!
Thanks! I know we can do it.
After all, they picked us for this mission for a reason.
Just keep pushing. Waiting here too long makes us vulnerable to an attack.
Oh, bloody hell!
What is it?
Contacts on my Type 79Y radar.
I should have kept my mouth shut...
@BATTLE
Ready for a situation report, Captain?
You look full of yourself, Sheffield. I hope that means good news.
Affirmative!
Don't keep me in suspense.
The damage reports are in. We made it through that last field of ice without any significant damage to our convoy!
Great news. Let's keep that good luck going.
It should be smooth sailing for a while.

Fields.MenuText: Your grit carved a path ahead where there was none, Sheffield.
Your spirit inspired the crew to stay strong.
Don't start celebrating. It's not over yet.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh! Well... um... it was a team effort, but thank you, Cap!
I... I'm flattered you think so, Cap.
I don't imagine you charm a lot of people at parties with that gloomy attitude, Captain.
We have a long way to go, but you should be proud of what you've accomplished so far.
Take some of that credit for yourself. I think we get along quite well together. Don't you agree?
I'd say--
*ALARM*
I should have said that "smooth sailing" was a relative term...
Battle stations, Sheff. Let's sort this out.
Those Morgs better not hurt my convoy!
@BATTLE
Mind if I pop in, Skipper?
Of course not. What's on your mind?
You've been alone in here for a bit. Need something hot and British to perk you up?
What?!
I've brought you a spot of some black English tea.
Oh.
I discovered a few bags of the good stuff when I was inspecting the food storage. You seemed a bit tired, so I figured it might do you some good.

Fields.MenuText: Thanks. That's quite thoughtful of you, Sheffield.
I'm more of a coffee drinker, you know.
Were you trying to flirt with me just now?

Fields.DialogueText: A Belle should take extraordinary care of her captain!
Don't be a sourpuss. That grumpy talk just proves that you need some tea.
What do you mean?
Budge up, Cap. Make some room for me to pour you a cup.
Oh no! Are you wearing your skates?
Of course! The roller skating endurance record isn't going to break itself.
Just be careful with that teapot, would you?
Don't fret. I'm a nimble angel on these skates, as you-
*RUMBLE*
Whoa!
Hot!
Captain! Did I spill tea on you? Are you all right?
I'll be fine... but we definitely just hit something. Let's get to the bridge!
@BATTLE
Forget it.
Of all the bloody luck. I'm so embarrassed...
How did we end up stuck like this on solid ice?
I blame myself, Cap. With all of the rain and bad visibility lately, I was relying on my Type 79Y radar...
It's all right. I understand. The radar helped us spot big chunks of ice before, but recognizing an entire horizon of ice on a radar screen isn't the same thing.
I appreciate you saying so. Also, I'm sorry about spilling that tea on you earlier.
No harm done.
And falling on top of you.
What a right mess we were, all tangled up in each other's arms and legs like that.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think the bridge crew needs to hear anymore about that.
It was kind of funny!
We have bigger things to think about right now.

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, Cap. I got carried away.
It sure was! Glad we could both laugh it off.
Ahem. Right, of course.
There is some good news, Skipper. When we hit the ice, the convoy ships behind us were able to stop in time.
Let's get free of this ice and get everybody to back up. We'll have to find another way around.
Wait! There's something really important we need to do first!
Whatever it is, it will have to wait. Get the navigator to mark our location and plot a new course to Arkhangelsk.
*sigh*... Aye aye, Cap.
@BATTLE
But - my radar's picking up some signals now. Get ready for a fight!
Situation report for you, Skipper.
Go ahead.
The navigator has marked our position and radioed back to Command to let them know about the ice. He's also busy plotting a detour to get our convoy to Arkhangelsk.
Understood. What's the convoy's status?
Right as rain. All vessels are regrouping. When we have a new course, they'll be ready to go.
Sounds like you've got everything covered.
I do... Now guess what I have behind my back!

Fields.MenuText: Another teapot full of scalding water?
A magic lamp we can use to wish our way to Arkhangelsk?
I don't do guessing games. Just tell me.

Fields.DialogueText: Interesting guess, but no. Not this time...
That would be nice, but I have something almost as good...
Goodness! It sounds like somebody needs to learn how to have fun. Fortunately, I have just the thing for that...
Ice skates!
You can't be serious.
Why not? The weather is clear right now, and we've got a big sheet of ice next to the ship. Besides, it will be a while before the convoy is ready.
I like the idea, but we have more important things to-
Aw, come on. When will we have another opportunity like this?
Well...
*ALARM*
Bloody hell! I swear those Morgs show up just to ruin every chance for fun around here!
Sheff...
Of course, Cap. My guns are ready.
@BATTLE
Let me see...
From that smile on your face, I'll wager you never expected you'd go ice skating with your Belle while you were on an Arctic convoy mission.
You're right. I'd have been a fool to take that bet.
It was a rush, wasn't it? Skating out there was amazing! Did you enjoy it, Cap?

Fields.MenuText: I loved it. Thanks for convincing me to go with you.
It was freezing cold, but it was still an experience.
I liked how the Morganas were kind enough to leave us alone the whole time.

Fields.DialogueText: My pleasure, Cap. You're completely and utterly welcome.
I had so much fun, I didn't even notice the cold.
That was a spot of luck, wasn't it? I had my radar emitting just in case.
It was a little bit strange that you went in your roller skates, though. Why didn't you use ice skates?
Don't tell me you've forgotten! If I'd have taken off my roller skates, I'd have to start all over to break the endurance record.
You have a point.
Thanks again for doing something fun with me, Cap.
Spending time with you is--
*ALARM*
Hold that thought, Skipper. Time to get cracking!
@BATTLE
Steady on course two-three-five, Skipper.
Very well, Sheffield.
How depressing to be driving away from Arkhangelsk! Going backwards is not something I enjoy at all.
You know that we have to head southwest to get around that ice. It's the only way to get this convoy to Arkhangelsk.
Ugh! It still feels like defeat all the same.

Fields.MenuText: Try to stay positive, Sheffield.
I don't like it either, but this is how we get through.
Don't complain like that in front of the crew. You don't want to hurt their morale.

Fields.DialogueText: Doing my best, Cap. I'll be right as rain.
You're right, Cap. Of course.
How careless of me, Skipper. A Belle should be a source of inspiration to the crew.
Let's make sure the ships in our convoy have a strong British cruiser to get them to Arkhangelsk, all right?
I'll get them all to the Soviet Union, no matter how long it takes. And I'll do it with a stiff upper lip the whole way.
That's what I wanted to hear.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
... and that's not what I wanted to hear.
Still nothing on the radio, Cap. I can't find them!
I saw Black Osprey take a big hit from one of the Morganas in that last skirmish, but then I lost her in the battle.
Those Morgs are just wretched!
Black Osprey, repeat, Black Osprey this is HMS Sheffield. Can you hear me?

Fields.MenuText: Keep trying a little bit longer.
Black Osprey is probably sunk.
Sheffield, put the radio handset down and look at me.

Fields.DialogueText: I will!
Don't give up on them! We can't turn our backs on them.
I don't want to!
We'll circle around one more to look for survivors, but eventually, this convoy will have to get moving again.
Of course, Captain, but my radar tells me we've got something.
A survivor?
Not unless this survivor is shaped like a Morgana and can swim at a speed of over twenty knots.
Sheff, you could have just said that we had Morganas incoming....
If Black Osprey really is gone, then somebody needs to avenge her!
@BATTLE
When is this brutal storm going to let up? The seas are tossing us around like a toy! If I haven't said so before, Sheffield, I'm impressed.
By what, Cap? If you're trying to cheer me up, I'll expect you to put some effort into it.
I'm not trying to cheer you up. I'm honestly amazed at how a steel ship can bravely face rough weather and prevail. A storm like this would flatten a building...
And yet, forward we go. Nice work, by the way.
What do you mean by that?
You did manage to cheer me up.

Fields.MenuText: I know the loss of the Black Osprey was difficult for you.
Steady as she goes, Sheffield.
You're enjoying this storm, aren't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Fortunately, we managed to rescue many of its crew. But yes, it has been.
Can do.
It's a wild ride. You know, I've never competed in a rodeo before, but this must be what it feels like to ride a bull.
Thanks for the boost, Captain.
We're in this together, Sheffield. Let's get our convoy through this storm together, too.
I won't let any of them fall behind.
@BATTLE
Sheffield, is that you?
*THUD*
Reporting as ordered!
Close the door for a minute.
I know that look, Cap. You've been thinking of a question you want to ask me. And I know that if you close the door, it's probably a doozy.
Not this time. I had something to share with you. Want a drink?
Ha! You're a sly dog, getting some vodka from those Soviets.

Fields.MenuText: Was it really that obvious?
You don't approve of it.
Then have one with me.

Fields.DialogueText: We've been through a lot together, Skipper. I'd like to think I can read your mind a little bit.
You must be taking the mick, Cap. A British Belle is no stranger to a little bit of alcohol on board.
Don't mind if I do!
Consider it a celebration for the little victories, Sheffield.
Cheers!
Gulp!
Gulp!
Whew! That warms the... cough cough... cockles, doesn't it?
You know what else does? A good fight!
Not you and me, silly. The Morgs I just picked up on my Type 79Y.
How far away?
Twenty nautical miles, give or take.
Time for one more shot, then?
@BATTLE
Look out! Another big chunk of ice off the starboard bow.
What a big frozen bastard that one is! Ha! Not a problem for Shiny Sheff.
I can swerve around these bloody things all day long!
Speaking of swerving...
What's that, Cap?

Fields.MenuText: Don't get cocky. I need you to be careful.
Why are you so confident?
Did you borrow some of the vodka from my cabin?

Fields.DialogueText: Trust me, I'm being careful.
Look at it this way, Cap.
No! I promise you, my hands are steady.
I know the ice is dangerous, but I try to see it as a bit of a game. My competitive nature always brings out my best.
Just don't lose this game. I wouldn't give us good odds in a collision with any of these icebergs.
If the Soviets can navigate conditions like this, why can't we? What can a Soviet do that an English Belle can't?
I'm not sure how any non-Soviet could ever grow accustomed to this cold. It's biting.
Did you lose that hat I gave you? Put it on, honestly!
@BATTLE
Hard cheese, Cap. Another convoy ship took a bad hit in that last combat.
Which one?
Tregenna.
Damn. That's a lot of coal that won't get to Arkhangelsk on time.
Tregenna's steam engines are full of holes, but she's still afloat.

Fields.MenuText: We can be thankful for that, at least.
The coal is still an issue.
We need to get the rest of these ships to the Soviet Union before we lose any more of them.

Fields.DialogueText: We're blessed with good luck, Cap. I hope we don't run out of it.
Honestly, Captain, that look on your face could spoil a saucer of milk!
The mission! That's good, Cap. Focus on the positive things.
Let's tow Tregenna somewhere safe to hide until we can come back for her.
I'll radio that plan to her captain at once.
Aaaagh!
*THUD*
Are you all right?
Just a spot of trouble with my skates. Don't worry about it.
She's quite a Belle, staying strong through all of this...
@BATTLE
Worry about the Morganas! My radar's picking up some signals now!
Am I hallucinating, Sheffield? I can't tell if that's the port on the horizon or just another chunk of ice.
You might be batty, but the navigator told me we're only a few miles away from Arkhangelsk.
Glad to hear that! Some of our convoy ships look like they're about to fall apart.
Don't make them clean off the ice until they get to port...
That ice is probably all that's holding them together right now.
Ice, rust, or willpower.

Fields.MenuText: I respect those ships. Coming all the way up here and trusting a warship to defend them.
The sooner we get rid of this baggage, the better.
Can't quit now.

Fields.DialogueText: Good thing that warship is the Shiny Sheff!
That's just the cold making you grumpy. I know you don't really mean that.
Don't give up yet. We're almost there!
A thousand miles from home in a frozen wasteland, and a wild girl in roller skates is keeping me sane.
Then it's settled. I, Doctor Sheffield, must deliver this terrible diagnosis. You're definitely bonkers! Haha!
Ha!
Thanks, Sheffield. I needed that.
*ALARM*
We can do it, Cap!
One more push...
@BATTLE
The convoy ships have all entered Arkhangelsk harbor, Cap. The first ones are already unloading their cargo.
We did it, Sheffield.
All of those supplies and lumber are going to make a huge difference for the Soviets and the city here. Help fortify them against the Morganas.
It's a shame some of the supply ships weren't able to complete their journey.

Fields.MenuText: We accomplished more than most.
At least it wasn't worse.
Don't kid yourself. You did great.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose.
Cold comfort, that.
It's a lot of mixed emotions, I suppose.
I do appreciate that you don't expect me to be chipper all the time, Cap. You've always stayed strong for me.
It's not just hot air, Sheffield. This convoy accomplished their mission because they followed a fine British cruiser. You should be proud.
Thanks, Cap.
You earned it... but if you find any hot air, blow it my direction. This port's a cold one.
My radar's found something almost as good. Perhaps a fight with some Morgs will warm your heart!
Unbelievable. Let's reward their persistence with a few holes, shall we?
@BATTLE
Brrr! Don't mention any more cold...
Hope you don't mind me barging in, but...
If you're going to ask me to ice skate again, I'm afraid the answer has to be no. I'm just too cold.
In that case, maybe I could get you some tea and...
*THUD*
Oh, pardon me, Cap. It seems we've crashed into each other and fallen to the deck. We're just a big jumble of arms and legs again, aren't we?

Fields.MenuText: Did something hit us?
Did you lose your balance?
Did you crash into me on purpose?

Fields.DialogueText: In a manner of speaking.
Not exactly.
Well...
This crash wasn't an accident, was it?
Um...
Sheffield, do you have something you need to say to me?
Well, it's just that...
Yes?
It seems like... somewhere along the way, we became more than just a Belle and her Captain.
I feel the same way, Sheffield.
*ALARM*
Maybe we ought to get up before the crew finds us like this?
Unfortunately, I think that would be best.
*ALARM*
